body_html:
Thank you for the PR.

preprocessing_function is an existing argument to ImageDataGenerator, which allows you to add a custom processing step for each batch of data. It is called at the start of standardize.

In you need more advanced types of preprocessing than what can be covered by this built-in setup, I recommend that you subclass ImageDataGenerator to add this functionality while reusing as much of the built-in features as possible.

After reviewing your proposal, we decided not to merge it.

By the way, this part of the code has migrated to its own repository: https://github.com/keras-team/keras-preprocessing

In the future, if you wish to make any PRs to Keras preprocessing, please send your PR to this repository.

By the way, this part of the code has migrated to its own repository: https://github.com/keras-team/keras-preprocessing

body:
Thank you for the PR.

`preprocessing_function` is an existing argument to `ImageDataGenerator`, which allows you to add a custom processing step for each batch of data. It is called at the start of `standardize`.

In you need more advanced types of preprocessing than what can be covered by this built-in setup, I recommend that you subclass `ImageDataGenerator` to add this functionality while reusing as much of the built-in features as possible.

After reviewing your proposal, we decided not to merge it.

By the way, this part of the code has migrated to its own repository: https://github.com/keras-team/keras-preprocessing

In the future, if you wish to make any PRs to Keras preprocessing, please send your PR to this repository.
